channel.title: NPR Programs: Morning Edition
channel.description: Morning Edition takes listeners around the country and the world with multi-faceted stories and commentaries every weekday. Hosts Steve Inskeep, Leila Fadel, Michel Martin and A Mart√≠nez bring you the latest breaking news and features to prepare you for the day.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Trump expected to meet with China's president in South Korea
item.description: President Trump will visit Japan Monday before heading to South Korea, where he's expected to meet with Chinese President Xi Jinping.
item.content:encoded: President Trump will visit Japan Monday before heading to South Korea, where he's expected to meet with Chinese President Xi Jinping.
item.dc:creator: Mara Liasson

item.title: Former deputy secretary of state talks about Trump's visit to Asia
item.description: NPR's Michel Martin speaks with former Deputy Secretary of State Kurt Campbell about President Trump's visit to Asia, where he's looking to make deals and contain the rising influence of China.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Michel Martin speaks with former Deputy Secretary of State Kurt Campbell about President Trump's visit to Asia, where he's looking to make deals and contain the rising influence of China.
item.dc:creator: Michel Martin

item.title: Argentinian president wins critical midterm elections
item.description: Argentina's libertarian President Javier Milei won midterm elections Sunday, clinching a crucial vote of confidence that boosts his ability to carry out his controversial economic agenda.
item.content:encoded:
Argentina's libertarian President Javier Milei won midterm elections Sunday, clinching a crucial vote of confidence that boosts his ability to carry out his controversial economic agenda.

(Image credit: Luis Robayo)
item.dc:creator: Natalie Alcoba

item.title: Morning news brief
item.description: President Trump will meet with China's president Monday, Venezuela prepares for potential land strikes as U.S. builds up military off its coast, the government shutdown enters its fourth week.
item.content:encoded: President Trump will meet with China's president Monday, Venezuela prepares for potential land strikes as U.S. builds up military off its coast, the government shutdown enters its fourth week.
item.dc:creator: Steve Inskeep

item.title: Dodgers and Blue Jays meet for Game 3 of the World Series
item.description: The World Series between the Dodgers and the Toronto Blue Jays resumes Monday in Los Angeles. The series is tied 1-1 after a thrilling pair of games in Toronto.
item.content:encoded: The World Series between the Dodgers and the Toronto Blue Jays resumes Monday in Los Angeles. The series is tied 1-1 after a thrilling pair of games in Toronto.
item.dc:creator: Steve Futterman

item.title: Despite Trump's clearing of encampments, homelessness still exist in D.C.
item.description: Despite President Trump's federal intervention in D.C. and clearing of homeless encampments, there are people who still live on the streets. Service providers just have a harder time finding them.
item.content:encoded: Despite President Trump's federal intervention in D.C. and clearing of homeless encampments, there are people who still live on the streets. Service providers just have a harder time finding them.
item.dc:creator: Sarah Y Kim

item.title: Suspects arrested in brazen Louvre museum jewelry heist
item.description: Two suspects in the theft of crown jewels from the Louvre in Paris have been arrested, French officials say. They were apprehended thanks to video surveillance footage and DNA left at the scene.
item.content:encoded: Two suspects in the theft of crown jewels from the Louvre in Paris have been arrested, French officials say. They were apprehended thanks to video surveillance footage and DNA left at the scene.
item.dc:creator: Eleanor Beardsley

item.title: Matchmaking event helps car manufacturers meet American car part suppliers
item.description: Car manufacturers who want to avoid tariffs can buy parts from American suppliers, but the complicated supply chain can make networking hard. This unique form of speed dating hopes to solve that.
item.content:encoded: Car manufacturers who want to avoid tariffs can buy parts from American suppliers, but the complicated supply chain can make networking hard. This unique form of speed dating hopes to solve that.

item.title: In 'Fight Oligarchy,' Sen. Bernie Sanders calls for a political revolution
item.description: NPR's Leila Fadel speaks with Sen. Bernie Sanders about his book, "Fight Oligarchy," which argues oligarchic economic and political control has left millions of Americans struggling.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Leila Fadel speaks with Sen. Bernie Sanders about his book, "Fight Oligarchy," which argues oligarchic economic and political control has left millions of Americans struggling.
item.dc:creator: Leila Fadel

item.title: As the shutdown enters its fourth week, USDA says SNAP benefits will run out Nov. 1
item.description: As many federal workers enter their fourth week of working without pay, the USDA says food assistance benefits, known as SNAP, will run out Nov. 1.
item.content:encoded: As many federal workers enter their fourth week of working without pay, the USDA says food assistance benefits, known as SNAP, will run out Nov. 1.
item.dc:creator: Sam Gringlas
